entry.title: C-SPAN's In the Classroom Podcast: 60th Anniversary of the Cuban Missile Crisis

media:group.media:title: C-SPAN's In the Classroom Podcast: 60th Anniversary of the Cuban Missile Crisis
media:group.media:description:
October 1962 was a heated time during the Cold War for the U.S. and the Soviet Union. These two superpowers were on the brink of engaging in a nuclear conflict after the discovery of missiles in Cuba. In this episode, the team speaks with U.S. Naval Academy History Professor Brian VanDeMark to talk about this significant time in history and share C-SPAN resources to learn more about this topic.

entry.title: Kellyanne Conway on Trump 2024 Presidential Bid : "I think you can expect him to announce soon."

media:group.media:title: Kellyanne Conway on Trump 2024 Presidential Bid : "I think you can expect him to announce soon."
media:group.media:description:
Q: "When will Trump announce his 2024 presidential bid?"
Kellyanne Conway: "I give him a ton of credit for not announcing this year, for not stepping in the way of midterm candidates...I think you can expect him to announce soon."

entry.title: The Weekly Podcast: Campaign 2022 Debate Questions: Trump, Trump, Trump, Biden, Trump

media:group.media:title: The Weekly Podcast: Campaign 2022 Debate Questions: Trump, Trump, Trump, Biden, Trump
media:group.media:description:
Was the 2020 election stolen from Donald Trump? Is Joe Biden the legitimate president? Do you support Trump? Does he support you?
If you've been watching C-SPAN's coverage of the 2022 midterm elections -- after all, October is famously known as debate month at C-SPAN -- you've probably heard moderators and reporters ask these questions. Over and over.
In C-SPAN's podcast "The Weekly," it's a special round-up of C-SPAN's debate coverage.
But with a twist.
You won't get the answers. You get the questions.
And they all have to do with Donald Trump, Joe Biden, and the 2020 election.

entry.title: Fed Chair Powell on Interest Rate Hike: "We still have some ways to go."

media:group.media:title: Fed Chair Powell on Interest Rate Hike: "We still have some ways to go."
media:group.media:description:
Fed Chair Powell: "Today, the FOMC raised our policy interest rate by 75 basis points and we continue to anticipate that ongoing increases will be appropriate...Restoring price stability will likely require maintaining a restrictive stance of policy for some time." He added that the U.S. economy has slowed significantly from last year's rapid pace and "at some point...it will become appropriate to slow the pace of increases...We still have some ways to go and incoming data since our last meeting suggests that the ultimate level of interest rates will be higher than previously expected."
Full video here: https://www.c-span.org/video/?523964-1/federal-reserve-chair-powell-holds-news-conference

entry.title: Booknotes+ Podcast: Vivek Ramaswamy, "Nation of Victims"

media:group.media:title: Booknotes+ Podcast: Vivek Ramaswamy, "Nation of Victims"
media:group.media:description:
At age 37, Vivek Ramaswamy has already built and sold several companies. Before he began his career as an entrepreneur, he managed to serve as the valedictorian of his 2003 senior class at St. Xavier High School in Cincinnati, Ohio, and was a nationally ranked junior tennis player. Then there was a Harvard biology degree and graduation from Yale Law School. Ramaswamy has written two books. His latest is "Nation of Victims: Identity Politics, the Death of Merit, and the Path Back to Excellence."

entry.title: San Francisco Police Hold News Conference on Attack Against Paul Pelosi

media:group.media:title: San Francisco Police Hold News Conference on Attack Against Paul Pelosi
media:group.media:description:
San Francisco Police Department Chief William Scott on attack of Paul Pelosi, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband: "The suspect pulled the hammer away from Mr. Pelosi and violently assaulted him with it. Our officers immediately tackled the suspect, disarmed him, took him into custody, requested emergency backup and rendered medical aid. https://www.c-span.org/video/?523922-1/san-francisco-police-hold-news-conference-attack-paul-pelosi&live
